definition: to let go of sth held in one's mouth/(fig.) to relent/to yield
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
pine/CL:棵[ke1]
surname Song
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
matsutake (Tricholoma matsutake), edible mushroom considered a great delicacy in Japan

sentences.english: See LiuMin seems to some let go, victory however because be has no head for wine drunk.
sentences.chinese: 眼看刘敏似乎有些松口，胜利却因不胜酒力醉倒了。

sentences.english: After getting out of the valley, all greatly relaxed, looking back and taking pictures.
sentences.chinese: 出到谷口大家纷纷松口气，回望，拍照。

sentences.english: The boss gave her a break and let her try again.
sentences.chinese: 老板让她松口气，让她再试一次。

sentences.english: You can breathe a sigh of relief.Your drug test came back negative.
sentences.chinese: 松口气吧，你的药检呈阴性。

sentences.english: After $200 he tells them the room number.
sentences.chinese: 得了200美金后，他便松口告知房间号。

sentences.english: The stevedores tossedthrew the bags from high place into the hold. That brought on a lot of bags with seams slack.
sentences.chinese: 装卸工从高处向舱里抛袋子，这使得大量袋子松口。

sentences.english: On this issue have any signs of relenting.
sentences.chinese: 对这个问题有任何松口的迹象。

definition: see 鬆口|松口[song1 kou3]
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to give up/to abandon (a goal etc)/to let sth go/forget it/let the matter drop
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to give up
determined/unshakable
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to submit/to give in
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to agree (to do sth)/to promise
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
to give one's assent/to consent
to beg forgiveness
